meanings.definition: An instrument used to measure the local gravitational field.
meanings.sent1: The gravimeter showed how strong gravity was in that area.
meanings.sent2: Scientists used the gravimeter to study the gravitational pull of the Earth.
meanings.sent3: The gravimeter decided it was too heavy to measure anything today.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a gravimeter, always pulling her closer.
meanings.sent5: The gravimeter hummed softly as it calculated the gravitational force.

meanings.definition: A device that detects changes in gravity.
meanings.sent1: The gravimeter beeped when it sensed a shift in gravity.
meanings.sent2: The astronauts carried a gravimeter to monitor gravity fluctuations in space.
meanings.sent3: The gravimeter joked with the scale about detecting gravity changes.
meanings.sent4: His mood acted like a gravimeter, picking up on subtle shifts in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gravimeter buzzed excitedly as it registered the gravitational anomaly.
